The metical (Àtụ:IPAc-en; plural: meticais) is the currency of Mozambique, abbreviated with the symbol MZN or MT
It is nominally divided into 100 centavos
The name metical comes from Arabic مثقال (mithqāl), a unit of weight and an alternative name for the gold dinar coin that was used throughout much of Africa until the 19th century.
Metical (MZM) nọchiri anya escudo na par na 16 Juun n’afo 1980. E kewara ya na centavos otu nari

Mgbe a gbanwere ego nke Romanian leu na 1 Julaị n’afo 2005, metical ghọrọ ego kacha nta, na uru nke ihe dịka 24,500 meticais kwa USD, ruo mgbe dollar nke obodo Zimbabwe weghaara aha ahụ na ngwụcha Ọgọst n’afo 2005.
Na Julai 1, n’afo 2006, Mozambique gbanwere aha metical na ọnụego nke otu puku: otu
E webatara mkpụrụ ego ọhụrụ na akwụkwọ ego ọhụrụ na Julai 1, n’afo 2006, oge mgbanwe nke enwere ike iji meticais ochie na nke ọhụrụ mee ihe ruo Disemba 31, n’afo 2006
N'oge ntụgharị ahụ, a na-eme ka ego ọhụrụ ahụ dị mkpirikpi dịka MTn, mana kemgbe ahụ, ọ laghachiri na MT.
Bank of Mozambique gbapụtara meticais ochie maka afọ isii, ruo na Disemba 31, n’afo 2012.
N'afọ 1980, e webatara mkpụrụ ego na 50 centavos, 1, 2+1⁄2, 5, 10 na 20 meticais
A na-eji aluminum emepụta centavos iri ise, 2+⁄2 na meticais ise, na otu metical na ọla na iri na meticais iri abuo na cupro-nickel
N'afọ 1986, ewepụtara aluminum otu, iri, iri abuo na iri ise meticais
Mkpụrụ ego ọhụrụ e wepụtara na afo 1994 nwere 1, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 500 na 1000 meticais, na okpukpu anọ dị ala na ọla kọpa na okpukpu ndị dị elu na nickel
E webatara mkpụrụ ego 5,000 meticais na afo 1998, 10,000 meticais sochiri na afo 2003.
